image.altText: A silhoutte of Donald Trump speaking to reporters against a blue sky with Marine Force One in the background.

props.synopsis: A frustrated US president swore, after Israel and Iran appeared to breach a truce, saying the two countries "don't know what the f*** they're doing".

title.children: Trump launches angry tirade at Israel and Iran as shaky ceasefire holds

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu gestures while addressing reporters from behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: In his first comments since the alleged ceasefire between Israel and Iran was announced, the US President let rip, and Israel's PM heard him loud and clear.

title.children: Trump's F-bomb is one missile that could sway Benjamin Netanyahu

image.altText: a composite image of two shots of CCTV with a title that reads "Suspected AI generation"

props.synopsis: The video was shared widely, even news agency picked it up, but are there signs of artificial intelligence manipulation?

title.children: Is this video of a Tehran prison explosion AI-generated?

image.altText: A short man with dark hair speaks animatedly to a tall man with grey hair, in an outdoor setting in front of green, lush trees.

props.synopsis: A two-day NATO summit at The Hague is intended to signal to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the alliance remains united, despite US President Donald Trump's repeated criticisms and threats to pull out if defence spending targets aren't met.

title.children: Trump to meet Zelenskyy at NATO summit as Russia-Ukraine war rages on

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant 4 analysis

props.synopsis: With so many questions about how this ban will work it might be time for the government to clear a runway for a temporary landing.

title.children: Labor doesn't need to rush to land the unwieldy social media ban

image.altText: Two men stand beside each other on a farm.

props.synopsis: This farming family has millions in super but proposed reforms have left them in a position where they may have to sell the farm.

title.children: Super changes will hit those with millions but they say the impact could be devastating

image.altText: Virgin Australia signs on a window, with ASX boards behind

props.synopsis: Virgin has undergone some radical surgery in the five years since it collapsed, and soared on its ASX re-entry, but the risks of investing in airlines remain.

title.children: Virgin boss dodges a disaster to bring the airline home

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin stands against a grey backdrop in a police mug shot.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Director of Public Prosecutions is appealing against the 14-year prison sentence Xiaozheng Lin received after pleading guilty to the manslaughter of two women in their homes in a 24-hour period in Melbourne in 2022.

title.children: 'Justice was not served': Sex workers welcome appeal of killer's sentence

image.altText: A close up of Jeff Bezos' face.

props.synopsis: The wedding party of the billionaire Amazon founder and his journalist fiancee Lauren Sanchez has been moved after weeks of protests against plans to transform Venice into a "private amusement park".

title.children: Jeff Bezos forced to move wedding after protests in Venice

image.altText: Childcare

props.synopsis: It seems without deeper reform the childcare system will continue to bleed public money while failing the children it's meant to serve.

title.children: 'Not just a technical glitch': Childcare subsidy program's missing $2.6b

image.altText: A close up of a man's hands placed together in front of his body in a worried pose.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says the National Mental Health and Suicide Prevention Agreement must be re-designed as it's failing to make any real change.

title.children: Australia's 'fundamentally flawed' mental health plan needs to be thrown out: report

image.altText: A young girl crying with her family behind her.

props.synopsis: More violence has erupted at an aid distribution centre in the Palestinian enclave as fighting continues between Israel and Hamas.

title.children: At least 40 Palestinians killed in single day as Gaza fighting continues

image.altText: Passengers at Doha airport are laying on the ground, trying to get some rest.

props.synopsis: Stranded passengers have faced chaos and uncertainty while waiting for flights either delayed or cancelled due to the Middle East conflict.

title.children: Stranded Aussie travellers desperate for updates as flights cancelled

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The judge in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial has told the jury that if they believe the evidence given by the accused at trial, they must find her not guilty.

title.children: Jurors must find Erin Patterson not guilty if they believe her, judge says

image.altText: Part of the hull and control room of a submarine that has surfaced from underwater.

props.synopsis: US politicians who have championed AUKUS have stepped up lobbying efforts with the Trump administration, saying the defence technology pact is "critical" to deterring "Chinese aggression".

title.children: US congressmen on both sides urge Trump to continue AUKUS sub deal

image.altText: A missile fires from a grassy area over the nearby ocean on a sunny day

props.synopsis: The test is another signal Tokyo wants to become more self-sufficient as China continues its push through the region.

title.children: Japan launches first missile test on home soil

image.altText: Drones depicting the Australian and Aboriginal flags in the night sky above a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Australia's only national survey tracking reconciliation has released new data showing an almost 40 per cent increase in racism during the past decade.

title.children: Most young people think Australia is a racist country, survey finds

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: Global mining giants Rio Tinto and Hancock Prospecting have received all necessary state and federal government approvals for the Hope Downs 2 iron ore project 80 kilometres north-west of Newman.

title.children: Multi-billion-dollar Pilbara mine expansion receives approval

image.altText: Underwater diver examines bright red coral

props.synopsis: Support is growing to limit or ban boats and fishing at a "pretty special" reef off the Sunshine Coast, as authorities install moorings to prevent anchors damaging the coral.

title.children: Call to make 'mind-blowing' south-east Qld reef a marine reserve

image.altText: Two men walking down a street carrying coffees

props.synopsis: The second complainant in the trial of NSW MP Gareth Ward has told the court the politician "fixed us drinks" on the night of an alleged assault at his home.

title.children: Complainant says Gareth Ward 'fixed us drinks' before alleged incident

image.altText: Map on NSW with red -$ and green +$ symbols

props.synopsis: From education, disaster responses and housing, the NSW government has unveiled its spending and saving plans for the coming financial year.

title.children: The winners and losers in this year's NSW budget

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes holding two ARIA number one trophies and smiling

props.synopsis: Old hits are being moved out to make space for new Australian music on the charts as ARIA implements new rules aiming to give homegrown talent a fairer chance at reaching the pointy end.

title.children: Australian music struggles on the charts, so ARIA is changing the rules

image.altText: kerbside collection items on front lawn

props.synopsis: While it's generally accepted that people will rummage through one another's kerbside collections, there are unwritten rules when it comes to doing so.

title.children: Is it OK to take items from other people's kerbside pick-up?

image.altText: A view from near the blast furnace of the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: At least 33 companies — a majority of them from overseas — are interested in acquiring the Whyalla steelworks, according to SA Premier Peter Malinauskas.

title.children: 'At least 33' potential buyers for the Whyalla steelworks, SA Premier says

image.altText: Trump wears a red MAGA cap in a boardroom. JD Vane seen in the foreground

props.synopsis: The hours since US President Donald Trump told the world a ceasefire had been brokered between Iran and Israel have been peppered with confusion and contradiction.

title.children: Breaking down the confusion during the countdown to Trump's ceasefire

image.altText: Donald Trump in blue suit and Maga hat red making fist

props.synopsis: Not long after tit-for-tat escalation between Iran and America was a looming danger, the US president and his supporters are hailing a new era of peace in the Middle East.

title.children: As Trump celebrated a ceasefire, Iranian missiles killed Israelis

image.altText: Josh Inglis hits the ball

props.synopsis: Josh Inglis is ready to bat anywhere as Australia shuffles its line-up yet again for the three-Test series against the West Indies.

title.children: Another reshuffle looming for Australia in West Indies Tests

image.altText: An aeroplane tail

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia's shares have rallied by about 8 per cent as it has listed on the stock exchange five years after its collapse. The airline's initial public offering was priced at $2.90 per share, raising $439 million for the company.

title.children: Five years ago it collapsed. Now Virgin Australia is back on the ASX

image.altText: A man and a boy run desperately through grass towards the camera as they are chased by zombie-like creatures.

props.synopsis: The eagerly anticipated sequel to 2002's unexpected runaway undead hit holds at its centre a surprisingly compelling human story. And there's Ralph Fiennes, as you've likely never seen him.

title.children: We waited two decades for a 28 Days Later sequel. It doesn't disappoint

image.altText: Spiral galaxy in foreground, lots of stars behind.

props.synopsis: The first videos released by the Vera C. Rubin Observatory reveal thousands of drifting asteroids, hundreds of thousands of stars and millions of distant galaxies.

title.children: World’s biggest digital camera spots 2,000 new asteroids in just hours

image.altText: A man wearing a black singlet walking through a media pack.

props.synopsis: John Torney's negligent manslaughter trial is further delayed after his mother and brother escape a fire that destroyed their home days before appearing in court.

title.children: Manslaughter trial delayed after key witnesses escape fire

image.altText: Water in a building.

props.synopsis:
A court has been told a man experiencing drug-induced psychosis broke into a medical research facility and set off fire hydrants. 

Tens of thousands of litres flooded the property, causing nearly $8 million in damages.

title.children: Medical centre trespasser caused 'over $7 million in damages'

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a petri dish.

props.synopsis: Thirty-two people have died from melioidosis in Queensland this year, with the latest fatality recorded in the past seven days.

title.children: Cairns hospital patient dies from rare, soil-borne disease

image.altText: A man in a blue suit walking along a pathway

props.synopsis: The Shepparton driver allegedly sped through a stop sign in country Victoria and collided with two other vehicles, fatally injuring his young passenger and leaving another man seriously hurt.

title.children: Driver to face trial over intersection crash that killed 16-year-old

image.altText: Young violinist Chloe Chua in a black and white gown performing in front of the Singapore Symphony Orchestra in Sydney.

props.synopsis: From Geoffrey Tozer to child prodigies today, audiences are fascinated by young performers. We ask how these musicians balance their passion with other interests.

title.children: Child prodigies speak about the importance of just being kids
